pageContext.claim: “I will say this — and we’ve been given tremendous credit, because the Olympics was not going well.  And when they came in out of the blue and they said, we’d love to participate in the Olympics, it made the Olympics very successful.  President Moon of South Korea was very generous in his statements, as to the fact that we had a lot to do with that, if not everything.  We had a lot to do with it.”
pageContext.analysis: The opposite is true here. President Moon called on the U.S. to tamp down it's harsh rhetoric toward the North in advance of the games, fearing a preemptive strike by the U.S. or an attack from the North. The U.S. certainly had the opportunity to de-escalate the pending crisis but did not move to do so. Instead it was the South who invited the North to send athletes to the games, which helped assure there would be no disruptions. Trump also twists Moon's words. At the dinner for Ivanka Trump before when she arrived in Seoul, Moon said that President Trump's active support and attention had been a "very important factor" in the success of the Olympic games.
